page.title: 03Landscape (notable features)
page.content: In the central part of the eastern cliffs are the old granite quarries. In 1865,when they were opened,they gave employment to more than 200 people. Further N.is Tibbets Point-the second highest point on the island and site of an old Admiralty lookout. The island is quartered(rather unfairly!) by 3 east/west walls and the track running north through the centre of the island is marked throughout its length by large blocks of granite. In the S.W.the Old Light stands on the island's highest point.Despite its height it was often obscured by fog and from 1863 to 1897 warnings were fired from the Battery which is down the cliffs to the north. Nearby is the Earthquake and north again the Devil's Slide -popular with rock climbers.
